bibl.title: How to be a Jew in Hellinistic Egypt?
bibl.note: Enlarged version of a paper presented to the Conference on "Diasporas in Antiquity" organized by Brown University, Providence, RI, on April 30, 1992. - I. Semantic ambiguities and historical contingencies. - II. Jewish diaspora, Greek colonialism. - III. The Limits of allegiance. - IV. An intellectual's illusion [the Alexandrian Jew Demetrius]. - Conclusions.
bibl.seg: MODRZEJEWSKI (MÉLÈZE MODRZEJEWSKI) Joseph, How to be a Jew in Hellenistic Egypt?
Shaye J.D. COHEN and Ernest S. FRERICHS, Diasporas in Antiquity = Brown Judaic Studies. 288 (Atlanta, Georgia, 1993) pp. 65-92.

Enlarged version of a paper presented to the Conference on "Diasporas in Antiquity" organized by Brown University, Providence, RI, on April 30, 1992. - I. Semantic ambiguities and historical contingencies. - II. Jewish diaspora, Greek colonialism. - III. The Limits of allegiance. - IV. An intellectual's illusion [the Alexandrian Jew Demetrius]. - Conclusions.
